Hippocampal mossy fiber.Title: The dentate gyrus: fundamental neuroanatomical organization (dentate gyrus for dummies)
Hippocampal mossy fiber.Definition: Axon of dentate gyrus granule cell projecting to hippocampal area CA3, characterized by expansions (mossy fiber expansions) giving the fibers a mossy appearance.  These unmyelinated axons were first described by Ramon y Cajal.
